title: 3 Ways to Verify Your Roblox Account: Badges, Phone, ID

steps.title: Meet the notability requirements.
steps.content: Meet the notability requirements. If you're a creator, developer, public figure, or notable group, you can apply for a Roblox verification badge as long as you meet the requirements. Once you're verified, a blue checkmark will appear next to your name in the Marketplace, on your profile, on item and experience details pages, and in search. [1] X Research source Use the chart below to see if you qualify for a Roblox verification badge. Brands & Figures (companies, celebrities, musicians, politicians, etc.) ▼100K+ followers on at least one major social media platform (Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, FB, YouTube) or 100K+ monthly listeners on Spotify. ▼Or, you are part of the Video Stars program. Experience Developers ▼You are an owner of an experience with playtime exceeding 1M hours in the last 90 days. ▼Or, you are a contributor to such an experience and have at least 10K legitimate followers on Roblox. A legitimate follower is someone who appears to be a real user, as opposed to a bot. Creators of Avatar Items ▼ You (or your group) have at least 2M Robux in revenue for the last 90 days with at least 200K items sold.

steps.title: Complete ID verification.
steps.content: Complete ID verification. If you meet the notability requirements, you'll also need to verify your identity by providing ID. It's the same process as verifying your age on Roblox, which requires a government-issued ID and a mobile device that you can use to take your picture. [2] X Research source See this method to learn how.

steps.title: Protect your Roblox account with an authenticator.
steps.content: Protect your Roblox account with an authenticator. To get a blue checkmark, you'll need to have been using an authenticator on the Roblox platform for 180 days. An authenticator is an app on your phone that provides you a code each time you sign in to Roblox. You can use apps like Google Authenticator , Microsoft Authenticator, Duo, or Twilio Authy. Find if you have an authenticator active by going to Account Settings > Security on the Roblox website. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Contact your Roblox partnership liaison to start the application process.
steps.content: Contact your Roblox partnership liaison to start the application process. If you meet all the requirements, contact your Roblox partnership contact to get your verification badge. Roblox only gives out verification badges once per month, so it can take a while to get one even after you've applied. The requirements for the verified badge on Roblox sometimes change, so refer to https://en.help.roblox.com/hc/en-us/articles/7997207259156-Verified-Badge-FAQ for up-to-date information. You can lose your verification badge if your account violates the community standards and TOS, you remove the authenticator from your account, change your username or display name, change the group name, or change the group owner.

steps.title: Go to https://www.roblox.com/home open your Settings.
steps.content: Go to https://www.roblox.com/home open your Settings. If you want to verify your age and identity, use your Roblox account to publish more content in the Creator Store, monetize your plugins, and access age-restricted features like voice chat , you will need to provide ID. To open Settings, click the gear at the top-right and select Settings . [4] X Research source To verify your account with an ID, you'll need a few things: Be at least 13, have a government-issued ID with your picture on it, have a mobile device like a phone or tablet that can take your picture when prompted.

steps.title: Click Verify My Age.
steps.content: Click Verify My Age . It's under the "Personal" header.

steps.title: Scan the QR Code.
steps.content: Scan the QR Code. Use your mobile device to scan the code and start the verification process.

steps.title: Tap Start Session.
steps.content: Tap Start Session . This opens a prompt for camera permission. Tap Allow to continue to use the camera.

steps.title: Take a picture using the prompts.
steps.content: Take a picture using the prompts. You'll be asked for different pictures of your face and government-issued ID. Once you take a picture, you should see an "Age Verified" message. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Go to Settings at https://www.roblox.com/home.
steps.content: Go to Settings at https://www.roblox.com/home . If you want to access age-restricted features like voice chat , are 13 or older, and have a phone number that can receive texts, you can verify your Roblox account using just your phone number. To get started, click the gear at the top-right corner and select Settings . While you can verify your age without an ID on Roblox, you won't be able to sell on the Creator Store unless you However, you won't be able to sell content on the Creator Store unless you verify with an ID .

steps.title: Click Add Phone.
steps.content: Click Add Phone . It's under the "Account" header.

steps.title: Enter your country code and phone number.
steps.content: Enter your country code and phone number. You will get a text message with a code to enter into the site to verify your account. Enter your password to confirm your action. Click Add Phone again to get the text message.

steps.title: Enter the 6-digit verification code into the field on the screen and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter the 6-digit verification code into the field on the screen and click Continue . After a few moments, the "Phone number" field on your screen will change to your phone number and say "Verified".
